STATUS.md.summary: v0.2.0 packaged. Build health verified. 72 tests. 9 gaps mapped to task IDs. 5 components assumed.

LOG.md.summary: 3 sessions: task audit (2026-02-27), CI pipeline T-001 (2026-02-27), bootstrap (2026-02-27).

DASHBOARD.md.summary: 9 components with test counts. 72 tests across 5 suites. 9 open tasks (6 ready, 3 blocked). T-004 + T-005 are next.

TRUST.md.summary: 7 verified components (reader, spawner, monitor, statusbar, security, CI, .vsix). 5 assumed (chat, injector, commands, sidebar, lifecycle).

CONVENTIONS.md.summary: TypeScript strict, VS Code API rules, Three Laws, no em dashes, no direct main pushes.

WORKFLOW.md.summary: 5-phase AAHP pipeline. VS Code extension specific: webview CSP, try/catch, vsce package notes.

quick_context: aahp-orchestrator v0.3.0: VS Code extension that injects AAHP context into Copilot and Claude Code. Marketplace-ready with icon, metadata, and publish script. 248 unit tests (14 suites) + 26 integration tests (@vscode/test-electron, 5 suites), CI pipeline with xvfb integration tests, tag-triggered release workflow. Dashboard has aggregated task filtering (status/priority/repo) and sorting with nested batch rendering for atomic updates. All Open Tasks tree view has inline GitHub link buttons and enhanced tooltips with issue numbers. GitHub issue sync auto-imports issues into MANIFEST. To publish: set VSCE_PAT and run npm run publish or push a v* tag.

T-003.title: Publish to VS Code Marketplace
T-003.notes: Needs VSCE_PAT GitHub Actions secret from project owner. T-004 dependency is done but still requires human to provide VSCE_PAT.

T-004.title: Add CHANGELOG.md
T-004.notes: Required for VS Code Marketplace. Document v0.1.0 and v0.2.0 changes.

T-005.title: Aggregated all-repos open task view in sidebar
T-005.notes: Add a unified 'All Open Tasks' section to the sidebar dashboard that lists open/ready/in_progress tasks across all scanned repos, sorted by priority.

T-006.title: Add task creation from dashboard
T-006.notes: Currently can only change task status via dropdown. Add 'New Task' button/command that creates a task in MANIFEST.json with title, priority, and optional depends_on.

T-007.title: Agent retry on failure with backoff
T-007.notes: When an agent fails (status=failed), offer a retry button in the dashboard. Add configurable max retries (default 1) with exponential backoff.

T-008.title: GitHub release workflow (tag-triggered)
T-008.notes: Add .github/workflows/release.yml triggered on 'git tag v*'. Build .vsix, create GitHub release with asset, optionally publish to Marketplace.

T-009.title: Test chat-participant and context-injector
T-009.notes: chat-participant and context-injector are 'assumed' - no unit tests. Add tests for slash command handlers (help, status, tasks, next, done, phase) and context clipboard copy.

T-010.title: Integration tests with VS Code extension host
T-010.notes: Set up @vscode/test-electron for integration tests that run inside a real VS Code instance. Test activation, command registration, webview rendering.

T-011.title: Dashboard task filtering and sorting
T-011.notes: Add filter controls to the aggregated task view: filter by status (ready/blocked/done), by priority (high/medium/low), by repo. Sort by priority then age.

T-012.title: T-010: Integration tests with VS Code extension host
T-012.notes:
Set up real VS Code extension host tests using `@vscode/test-electron`.

Verify the extension actually activates, registers commands, and renders webviews.

**From AAHP NEXT_ACTIONS**

T-013.title: T-009: Test chat-participant and context-injector
T-013.notes:
Add unit tests for the two untested modules:

- `chat-participant.ts` has 7 slash command handlers
- `context-injector.ts` registers clipboard copy + one-time banner
- At least 15 tests for chat-participant, 5 for context-injector

**From AAHP NEXT_ACTIONS**

T-014.title: Bug: Dashboard first render incomplete + intermittent missing aahp.refreshAll command
T-014.notes:
## Summary
On VS Code startup, the AAHP dashboard often renders in a degraded single-project state (only `PROJECT` section for one repo).
After running `AAHP: Refresh Dashboard`, the dashboard switches to the expected multi-repo layout (`REPOS`, `ALL OPEN TASKS`, metrics/cards across many repos).

In affected sessions, running `AAHP: Refresh Dashboard` from Command Palette can also fail with:
`command 'aahp.refreshAll' not found`.

## Impact
- Startup UX is inconsistent and misleading.
- Users m

T-015.title: Add GitHub links to All Open Tasks tree view
T-015.notes: Inline GitHub icon button on each task in the All Open Tasks tree view. Opens direct issue URL (when github_issue is linked) or falls back to GitHub Issues search. Enhanced tooltip shows GitHub issue number. 7 new tests in commands-github.test.ts, 2 tooltip tests in task-tree.test.ts.

T-016.title: Dashboard requires manual refresh after VS Code startup
T-016.notes:
## Priority: HIGH

## Problem

Every time VS Code starts, the AAHP Dashboard does not automatically refresh. The user must manually trigger a refresh via:

1. Press `Ctrl+Shift+P` to open the Command Palette
2. Type `AAHP: Refresh Dashboard`
3. Execute the command

This is disruptive to the workflow and should not be necessary on every startup.

## Expected Behavior

The dashboard should automatically refresh/initialize when VS Code starts (or when the extension activates). No manual interventio
